Title: Periphrasis
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Periphrasis is a figure of speech based on the use of a longer phrase in place of a possible shorter and plainer form or expression.

A roundabout way of expressing something. It is often associated with formal or elevated styles of speech and writing. Periphrasis often points at one of the seemingly insignificant features of the object and intensifies this feature by using it to name the object.

examples:

  • my better half - my wife
  • greedy next to Zvolen - Banská Bystrica
